profileAlternative.name: Tim Ellison
profileAlternative.headline: Senior Technical Staff Member at IBM
profileAlternative.summary:
Tim Ellison is currently a Senior Technical Staff Member in the Runtime Technology group at IBM Hursley Park. He has worldwide responsibility for innovation in the managed runtimes underpinning a broad selection of IBM's flagship products.

Prior to his current position, Tim held leadership positions within IBM Canada, Object Technology International, The Continuum Company, and others. He has contributed to the implementation of Smalltalk and Java for over 20 years. Tim was part of the original Eclipse development team, and has been a Vice President of the Apache Software Foundation and chair of the Apache Harmony Project Management Committee. He is currently a member of the JSR376 expert group designing a Java SE platform modularity system.

Tim holds a BSc in Computer Science from Hull University, and an MSc in Computer System Design from the University of Manchester. He has a broad knowledge of high performance runtimes, open source methodologies, and runtime technology; and he speaks at conferences worldwide on topics as diverse as secure engineering practices, GPU programming, and big data analytics. Tim is particularly interested in new ways of applying runtime technology to difficult problems.

aboutAlternative.text:

Tim holds a BSc in Computer Science from Hull University, and an MSc in Computer System Design from the University of Manchester. positions.title: PPMC Member, Mentor, Committer
positions.description: Apache Pirk is a framework for scalable Private Information Retrieval (PIR) currently in incubation at the Apache Software Foundation https://pirk.incubator.apache.org/

positions.title: V.P. Apache Harmony
positions.description: Project Management Committee chair for Apache Harmony, building a full implementation of the Java SE specification. Currently a Member of the Apache Software Foundation involved with a wide variety of projects.

positions.title: Team Leader
positions.description: Development of ENVY/Developer team programming system for Smalltalk, including packaging, team repository technology, and secure distributed systems. Later working as team leader for distributed repository implementation in Eclipse integrated development environment.

positions.title: Senior Programmer
positions.description: Design and delivery of three-tier client server architectures in the insurance industry. Numerous on-site consultancy and development roles in the USA, England, Scotland, and Germany.

positions.title: Consultant
positions.description: Development of cartographic information systems and the visual display of quantitative information in the natural resources industry.

items: Modules All The Way Down
Five Cool Ways the JVM Can Run Apache Spark Faster
Java on zSystems zOS
Vitualization Aware JVM
What's New in Java 8 SE?

Transparent network acceleration for Java-based workloads in the cloud

Java and Real-World Compatibility
The OpenJDK Penrose project
The Future of Java (Interview)
Inside IBM Java 7
Apache Harmony : An Open Innovation
The Java Async IO Package
Calculating the surface topography of integrated-circuit wafers from SEM images
Automated detection of abnormalities on screening mammograms
Java Community Process - JSR 379: Java SE 9 Release Contents
Java Community Process - JSR 376: Java Platform Module System
Java Community Process - JSR 337: Java SE 8 Release Contents
Apache Software Foundation
Java Community Process - JSR 147: Workspace Versioning and Configuration Management
Eclipse Foundation
Internet Engineering Task Force - WebDAV DeltaV Working Group
Dynamic Reduction of Stack-Overflow Errors in a Recursive Data-Serialization Algorithm
Managing Network Sockets
Launcher for Software Applications
Methods and systems for improving hash table performance
Method for replacing code in a running object oriented program
Managing Software Component Version Identifications in a Componentised Software System
Executing a native software routine in a virtual machine
